title: Dvein video font
content:
Hello,  
i would like to know what font is used for the amazing video of Dvein for The conference toca me.  
the link:  
 [http://www.dvein.com/videos/tocame.mov](http://web.archive.org/web/20080704194052/http:/www.dvein.com/videos/tocame.mov)

I attached also the image.  
Can you help me?  
thanks,  
enrico

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Immagine 2.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20080704194052/http:/typophile.com/files/Immagine%202.png) | 12.28 KB |

 [‹ PUBLIC SCHOOL 20 FONT ID](http://web.archive.org/web/20080704194052/http:/www.typophile.com/node/42578 "Go to previous forum topic") [Plzzzzz .... wt's this font?????? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080704194052/http:/www.typophile.com/node/42560 "Go to next forum topic")
author: noMad

comments.content: That would be Mr Lubalin’s [Serif Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20080704194052/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/serif-gothic/). Probably in bold

Thank you!  
I think it’s very similar but not the same font. I noticed the top of the “A” is different. Also the N and the M. The black version has the same serif in those point but it’s too much heavy..., any ideas?  
Thanks.

Sean’s correct, it’s Serif Gothic, actually the first part is [Serif Gothic Extra Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20080704194052/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/itc-serif-gothic/extra-bold/).

the second part is Serif Gothic Regular.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080704194052im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/Serif-Gothic_3732.gif)
thank you very much, very helpful.
